### Final project preparation and timeline.

Do you have a data source in mind for the course project?  We have 7ish weeks of class left (14ish classes) and next week is an exam.  So, this means that we have only six weeks left.  Please read the [Project Description](ProjectDescription.html).



####  Due Thursday, March 25 (Week 9)
Find a group. Turn in a list of teammates and a rough guess for project area / data source by class time on Thursday.


#### Thursday, April 1  (Week 10)


Please find a data source by Thursday, week 10. Write a short description of what the data measures and why you think it is interesting.  Provide a link to the data and a few rows of the data. Turn it in on canvas by class time on Thursday, week 10. 



#### Thursday, April 8  (Week 11)
Please write a short description of why you find your data source interesting.  Turn this in on canvas by class time on Thursday, week 11. 


#### Thursday, April 15 (Week 12)
Turn in your proposed thesis statement on canvas by class time on Thursday, April 15  You need a statement describing what your project does.  




#### Thursday, April 22 (Week 13)
Turn in "Figure 1" (draft) on canvas by Thursday, April 22.  Be sure to include a short description of it, so that it is a stand alone document.  State in the document what you see in the figure.  That is, what is the key message of the figure.  Ideally, this would align with the key message of your thesis statement and project. 

#### Turn in final project by May 5 at 5pm.
Please consult the [project description](projectDescription.Rmd) for more details.
